required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Screening of Helicobacter Pylori in Children of Positive Infected Mothers
clinical_study.official_title: Screening of Helicobacter Pylori Infection in Children of Positive Infected Mothers

brief_summary.textblock: Helicobacter pylori is aspiral shaped gram negative organism that colonized the gastric mucosa.it was showen that intra familial infection play role in transmission of H pylori and mother play the key role in transmission .

detailed_description.textblock: Prevelance of H pylori infection in children whose mother positive infected is different according to risks factors such as mother education,work out side or not , socioeconomic status, family size and breast feeding or not.H pylori in children can be represent with recurrent abdominal pain ,recurrent diarrhea,repeated vomitting ,pallor ,fulness,non variceal hematemesis,loss of appetite,reterded growth.complication of H pylori include gastric ulcer,duodenal ulcer,gastric atrophy may lead to gastric cancer and intestinal metaplasia.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess prevelance of H pylori infection in children born of infected positive mother
primary_outcome.description: By taken children whose mother infected ,how many of them infected by this microbe by taken these child and done the following investigastion as stool antigen test and biobsy if they are postive by test and then follow up by treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Asse the effect of Helicobacter pylori infection in children with anemia
primary_outcome.description: By knowing effect of this microbe on growth development of children by measure weigt /height through body mass index and measure heamoglbin level By taken children whose positive H pylori follow effect of this microbe on heamoglbin level and do investigation as complete blood count By following test such as complete blood count and heamoglbin level and if this microbe increase level of anemia or not

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Child with Dyspeptic symptoms
Exclusion Criteria:
malnutrition childs Patient with metabolic disorder

reference.citation: Warren JR, Marshall B. Unidentified curved bacilli on gastric epithelium in active chronic gastritis. Lancet. 1983 Jun 4;1(8336):1273-5.
Greenberg ER, Chey WD. Defining the role of sequential therapy for H pylori infection. Lancet. 2013 Jan 19;381(9862):180-2. doi: 10.1016/S0140-6736(12)61849-2. Epub 2012 Nov 16.
